message: Hi Bob, I'm selling this product that I believe will be a great asset for you. My asking price is $12,000. Let me know what you think!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. Would you be willing to meet me at this price?
Bob, I appreciate your interest.  $9,000 is a bit too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $10,500. This reflects the value of the product and gives us both a good deal. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to come down to $10,500, but I'm still a bit hesitant. I'd be willing to meet you halfway at $9,500. Would you be open to this price?

Bob, I understand your perspective. Let's split the difference. I'm willing to come down to $10,000. This is a fair price that reflects the product's value and allows us both to make a reasonable deal. I'm hopeful we can close this deal now.
I appreciate your willingness to come down to $10,000, but I'm still a bit short. I'd be willing to pay $9,750 for the product. Is this a price you'd be comfortable with?

Bob, I understand you're trying to get the best deal possible, but $9,750 is still too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $10,000 one last time. This is a fair price, considering the value of the product. If you're not willing to accept this, I'll have to move on to other options.
I understand you're trying to get a fair price, but I'm still not comfortable with $10,000. I'd be willing to meet you at $9,800. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
